intro: Cassuvium vitiense, commonly known as the Vanuatu starfruit, is a tropical plant native to the islands of Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Caricaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant produces bright yellow-orange fruits with a crisp, juicy pulp and a sweet-tart flavor. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires a warm climate with ample sunlight. Cassuvium vitiense is often cultivated for its ornamental value as well as its edible fruit.
